about_the_game:
Prism Warriors DX is the sequel to the acclaimed retro bullet hell shooter Prism Indigo DX. When Tokyo comes under attack from a mysterious group of evil magical girls calling themselves "the Twilight Four", the Prism Warriors must band together to stop them in their tracks and uncover their true scheme before time runs out...

Play as the whole spectrum

This time, all seven Prism Warriors are playable, each with their own unique Passive skill and rechargeable Special move. From Prism Amber's resilience, to Prism Saffron's rapid-fire assaults, to Prism Aqua's freezing abilities, you're sure to find a Prism Warrior that suits your playstyle.

The new Rainbow difficulty lets you play as all seven Prism Warriors at once, cycling from one to the next each time you lose a life. Be warned, though: should all seven of them fall, you'll have to start over from the beginning...

Overcome all-new challenges

In your pursuit of the Twilight Four, you'll face enemies with far more intricate patterns than in Prism Indigo DX. Bosses can now also enter Desperation Phases, switching up their patterns once their health drops low enough; pay attention to their health as well as their bullets, and try not to get caught off-guard.

With an expanded range of "White Label" cheats and "Black Label" handicaps, and almost twice as many in-game achievements to unlock, Prism Warriors DX offers plenty of ways for you to challenge yourself, whether you're a newcomer to bullet hell games, or a high-score-chasing veteran.

Enter the Simulacrum

Once you've beaten the main story, more challenges await in the Simulacrum: a virtual-reality training environment developed by Prism Aqua. Battle through the Boss Rush, endure the brutal 100-wave Marathon, and take on the Prism Duels: amped-up versions of Prism Indigo DX's boss fights.
